channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Palestinian Wounds Israeli Woman in West Bank, Military Says
item.description: The attack came the day after another Israeli woman was fatally stabbed at the entrance to her home in a settlement to the south.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: The body of an Israeli woman, who was fatally stabbed a day earlier at the entrance to her West Bank home in the Jewish settlement of Otniel, during her funeral on Monday.

item.title: Britain’s Parliament to Debate Donald Trump Ban
item.description: A parliamentary committee will consider an unusual petition on Monday to bar Mr. Trump from entering the United Kingdom because he has violated the country’s laws on hate speech.
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Battling ISIS in Indonesia
item.description: After years of mostly foiled plots, the terrorism threat in Indonesia has been transformed by the Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: SIDNEY JONES

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Stop China’s Market Manipulations
item.description: To protect the global economy, Washington needs to send Beijing a clear message.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT KENNEDY

item.title: Sinosphere: Charges Against Chinese Rights Lawyers Draw Foreign Criticism
item.description: In a letter, the presidents of foreign bar associations and lawyers call the subversion charges part of an “unprecedented crackdown” on Chinese rights defenders.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Huffington Post and CNN Waited to Report U.S.-Iran Prisoner-Swap Negotiations
item.description: CNN said the government asked it not to run information about negotiations over a prisoner exchange that included a Washington Post reporter. Huffington Post said it made the decision on its own.
item.dc:creator: SYDNEY EMBER
item.media:description: The wife of Saeed Abedini holding a necklace with a photograph of her husband, a pastor who was arrested in Iran in 2012. Iran announced on Saturday that it had released four Iranian-Americans, including Mr. Abedini, as part of a prisoner exchange with the United States.

item.title: 14 Testy Months Behind U.S. Prisoner Swap With Iran
item.description: The turbulent talks were punctuated by high diplomatic drama and near-collapses before a deal for a prisoner release was finalized.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER and DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, left, and Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif of Iran in 2015. They brought the prisoner exchange deal back from the brink over 14 months of negotiations.

item.title: White House Letter: Obama’s Goal to Wipe Out Malaria May Be a Dream Too Far
item.description: Under President Obama, the President’s Malaria Initiative has grown into a $618-million program that works in 19 African countries and in Southeast Asia. Yet the disease remains a top killer of children around the world.
item.dc:creator: GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:credit: Uriel Sinai for The New York Times
item.media:description: A man was treated for malaria in the village of Kirando, Tanzania. There were an estimated 214 million new malaria cases in 2015.

item.title: 3 Freed Americans Leave Iran; U.S. Places New Sanctions
item.description: The Obama administration announced the new measures less than 24 hours after lifting previous sanctions on Iran, which coincided with the country’s release of several Americans.
item.dc:creator: DAVID E. SANGER, RICK GLADSTONE and THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: The Swiss airplane that brought three American prisoners freed from Iran after landing in Geneva on Sunday.

item.title: Kabul Journal: A Businessman Who Trades in Hand-Me-Downs
item.description: In a shop that has seen its fortunes shift with those of Kabul, Afghanistan, Hajji Ramazan traded in used clothes, some from the United States.
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL
item.media:credit: Andrew Quilty for The New York Times
item.media:description: Hajji Ramazan at the used-clothing depot his father started 40 years ago in Kabul.

item.title: U.N.-Appointed Panel Calls for a Tax to Pay for Crises
item.description: A small tax on high-volume goods and services is among those proposed by a panel appointed by the United Nations to figure out how to pay for humanitarian crises.
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: Kristalina Georgieva of the European Commission, an author of the report, in Athens last month.

item.title: Missing Man Back in China, Confessing to Fatal Crime
item.description: Gui Minhai, co-owner of a Hong Kong publishing company that put out salacious works about mainland leaders, is accused in a fatal drunken-driving case from 2003.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE

item.title: Covering War at Home Costs a Yemeni His Life
item.description: Almigdad Mojalli, a Yemeni journalist covering the civil war in his country, was killed in airstrikes outside Sana while on assignment for Voice of America.
item.dc:creator: SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: British Labour Leader Offers Compromise on Trident Program
item.description: Jeremy Corbyn suggested that he might support the country’s Trident submarine fleet if it was sent on patrol without carrying nuclear warheads.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: The Trident submarine H.M.S. Victorious in 2013. Labour’s Jeremy Corbyn has suggested removing the nuclear warheads.

item.title: 3 Americans Are Missing in Baghdad, Embassy Says
item.description: The Americans’ disappearance raised fears that Westerners were again becoming targets for militias and criminal gangs that kidnap foreigners for money or political reasons.
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO

item.title: Iran Frees Americans, Including Jason Rezaian, in Prisoner Swap
item.description: Word of the exchange came just before longstanding economic sanctions on Iran were lifted under terms of the historic nuclear deal reached in July.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:credit: Zoeann Murphy/The Washington Post, via Reuters

item.title: Zika Warning Spotlights Latin America’s Fight Against Mosquito-Borne Diseases
item.description: The C.D.C. advisory for pregnant women to avoid more than a dozen Latin American countries comes only a few months before the start of the Olympic Games in Brazil.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO
item.media:description: A specialist fumigated a graveyard on the outskirts of Lima, Peru, on Friday. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned pregnant women not to travel to more than a dozen Latin American countries because of mosquito-borne diseases.

item.title: Details of 7 Iranians Granted Clemency in Prisoner Swap
item.description: None of the seven Iranians accused or convicted of violating American trade sanctions against Iran were charged with terrorism, President Obama noted.
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS FANDOS

item.title: Iran Complies With Nuclear Deal; Sanctions Are Lifted
item.description: Iran has shipped most of its nuclear fuel out of the country, destroyed the innards of a plutonium-producing reactor and mothballed more than 12,000 centrifuges.
item.dc:creator: DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: From left, Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister; Yukiya Amano, director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency; and Federica Mogherini, the European Union’s high representative for foreign affairs and security policy, at the meeting in Vienna.

item.title: Profiles of Saeed Abedini, Amir Hekmati and Jason Rezaian
item.description: Saeed Abedini, Amir Hekmati and Jason Rezaian are among the American citizens who have been held in Iran.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: Jason Rezaian, Saeed Abedini and Amir Hekmati
